interfaceFramework

Class Ghost

  • java.lang.Object
    • interfaceFramework.Ghost
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Blinky, Clyde, Inky, Pinky

    public class Ghost
extends Object
    The class representing the ghost object and all the attributes a ghost should have. The class takes care of the movement of the ghosts, and all the calculations the general ghost AI needs to perform relating to the position, speed and other factors

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ghost

        public Ghost(double x,
     double y)
        The constructs creates a ghost object in the given paramaters x and y
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of where the object should be placed on the board
        y - y coordinate of where the object should be placed on the board

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move(double x,
        double y)
        This is the method that controls the ghosts movement. It is set to random, however before a ghosts movements it checks if the upcoming coordinates are occupied with a wall.
        Parameters:
        ghost - used to find a particular ghost's coordinates
        board - used to check upcoming coordinates for walls

      • move

        public void move(int[][] board,
        boolean[] ghostDirection)
        The method takes care of the movement if the ghost based on its direction and relative to the board where all the objects exist
        Parameters:
        board - the board where the game is played by all the objects
        ghostDirection - the direction where the ghost is going towards, relative to the computer screen

      • getX

        public double getX()
        The method gets the current x position of the ghost relative to the board
        Returns:
        the current x position of the ghost relative to the board

        The method gets the current y position of the ghost relative to the board

      • distance

        public double distance(double tileX,
              double tileY,
              double x,
              double y)
        The method finds the euclidian distance between two coordinates
        Parameters:
        tileX - the tile where the x coordinate is on
        tileY - the tile where the y coordinate is on
        x - the x coordinate
        y - the y coordinate
        Returns:
        the distanve between the two tiles

      • ghostModes

        public static void ghostModes(long[] levelTiming)
        the method ensures the timing in which each ghost needs to stay in different modes liek scatter,chase and infinitechase
        Parameters:
        levelTiming - the timing for each mode for the ghost depending on the factors like level

      • shortestMovement

        public void shortestMovement(double targetX,
                    double targetY,
                    int[][] board)
        the method finds the shortest movement from where it is to the target x,y tile in the board
        Parameters:
        targetX - the target x tile where the ghost should go
        targetY - the target y tile where the ghost should go
        board - the board where the objects are placed on

      • randomMovement

        public void randomMovement(int[][] board,
                  Graphics g)
        the method generates a random movement on the board for a specific ghost
        Parameters:
        board - the board where the objects are interacting on
        g - the graphics that draws them

      • possibleExit

        public void possibleExit(int[][] board)
        the method finds which possible exits, out of the four ones, are available for a ghost
        Parameters:
        board - the board where the objects are interacting on
